required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Initial Safety Study of Gedatolisib Plus PTK7-ADC for Metastatic Triple-negative Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: An Initial Safety Study of Gedatolisib Plus PTK7-ADC for Metastatic Triple-negative Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 1 study to evaluate the safety and effect of Gedatolisib and PTK7-ADC for the treatment of triple negative breast cancer

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Study will enroll 3 patients to the cohort 1 dose level. If 0 of 3 patients experience a DLT, the study will proceed to cohort 2. If 1 patient experiences a DLT, 3 additional patients will be enrolled into cohort 1. If 1 of 6 patients experience a DLT, the study will proceed and 3 patients will be enrolled to the cohort 2 dose level. If 0 patients experience a DLT in cohort 2, the study will proceed to cohort 3. If 1 patient experiences a DLT at cohort 2, 3 additional patients will be enrolled into cohort 2. If the study proceeds to cohort 3, 3 patients will be enrolled at this dose level. If 0 patients experience a DLT, the study will enroll an additional 3 patients at the cohort 3 dose level to better define the safety profile. If 1 of 3 patients experiences a DLT at cohort 3, 3 additional patients will still be enrolled into cohort 3. If 1 of 6 patients experience a DLT, the study will complete.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety of Gedatolisb + PTK7-ADC using NCI CTCAE v4.0
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion i.e. up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: safety and toxicity data will be assessed using NCI CTCAE v4.0 and tabulated and reported

secondary_outcome.description: efficacy as determined by clinical benefit at 18 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate in all enrolled subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion i.e. up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: efficacy as determined by overall response rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression free survival in all enrolled subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion i.e. up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: efficacy as determined by progression free survival

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic determination of inhibition of PI3k signaling
secondary_outcome.description: Pathological H-score will be determined from tissue obtained at screening and Cycle 1 Day 15. H-score will be compared to calculate percentage inhibition between samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic determination modulation of Wnt pathway
secondary_outcome.description: pathological H-score will be determined from tissue obtained at screening and Cycle 1 Day 15. H-score will be compared to calculate percentage change in expression between samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic determination modulation of Wnt pathway
secondary_outcome.description: RNA sequencing of tissue collected at screening and Cycle 1 Day 1 to compare Wnt pathway expression after treatment

intervention.description: Gedatolisb will be intravenously administered on Day 1, Day 8 and Day 15 of every 21 day cycle at a dose of 110 mg or 180mg depending on cohort assignment.
PTK7-ADC will be administered on Day 1 of every 21 day cycle at a dose of 1.4mg/kg or 2.8 mg/kg depending on cohort assignment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Metastatic Triple-negative Breast Cancer
- Willingness to undergo tumor biopsy
- Patients must have received at least 1 prior chemotherapy regimen for metastatic disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous treatment with mTOR inhibitor
- Untreated brain metastases
